definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: oppress, wrong extort (Targum [[עֲשַׁק]] = BH, so OAram. [[עשק]]; Syr. 94aq accuse, slander; As. adj. esûḳu, strong; Ar. 9a4aqa roughness, injustice);—

oppress, wrong (oft. by extortion, ‖[[גׇּזַל]]), c. acc. pers. 1Sa 12:3, 1Sa 12:4, Mic 2:2, Le 5:21, Le 19:13; esp. the poor and helpless Am 4:1, De 24:14, Je 7:6, Ez Eze 22:29, Zec 7:10, Pr 14:31, Pr 22:16, Pr 28:3, Ec 4:1; also c. acc. cogn. [[גׇזַל גׇּזֵל]]([[וְ]])[[עשֶׁק ]] ´[[ע]] Ez Eze 18:18 practise extortion, Eze 22:29, take by extortion Le 5:23 and (c. acc. rei) Mal 3:5; abs. Ho 12:8 practise extortion; Job 10:3 deal tyrannically (of God); pt. oppressor, extortioner Je 21:12, Ps 72:4, Ec 4:1; pt. pass. as subst. the oppressed Ps 103:6, Ps 146:7.

oppress a nation Is 52:4, cf. Ps 105:14 = 1Ch 16:21, Ps 119:122, pt. act. oppressor v:Ps 119:121, pt. pass. oppressed Je 50:33, in predict. [[וְגׇזוּל]] ´[[ע]] De 28:29, [[וְרָצּוּץ]] ´[[ע]] v:De 28:23, Ho 5:11.

dub. are: [[יַעְשׁׂק נׇהָר]] Job 40:23 a river oppresses him, i.e. rushes violently upon him (sc. the hippopot.; Du [[יׇשׁׂק]], fr. [[שׁוּק]]; > Gunk Bu [[יִשְׁקַע]] falls, sinks); [[עָשֻׁק בְּדַם נֶפֶשׁ]] Pr 28:17 oppressed (? burdened) with the blood of a person.

definitions.body: Pt.  f. [[הַמְּעֻשָּׁקָה]] Is 23:12 crushed (of conquered Sidon under fig. of woman).
